TopicTitle: This Will Not End Well (post images of your craft in a precarious situation)

Articles.Content: How in the name of the Kraken did that happen? I mean, I know the biplanes are a little tough to fly, but to lose the engine, upper wing support, and lower wings, that had to take some doing.

How in the name of the Kraken did that happen? I mean, I know the biplanes are a little tough to fly, but to lose the engine, upper wing support, and lower wings, that had to take some doing.

Just a very hard landing. I thought everything had exploded but then the fuselage and cockpit came flying out...

TBH it was all attached to the node on the front of the fuselage, it was quite understrutted (Is that even a word?)

It had to be done..

For science..

The idea was to send out 4 probes, each with ion drives.

Not to mention a Kerbal strapped on top of them.

Opened the solar panels in orbit and they violently collided with each other, sending the pods flying out into space and debris everywhere..

Think I should of checked that before I launched..

Oops..

This pic is take 2, with the small solar panels that don't open.

Worked out pretty decent

More goodies here if you like pics: http://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561197989020946/screenshots/?appid=220200&sort=newestfirst&browsefilter=myfiles&view=imagewall

Edited November 13, 2014 by B15hop
Open the pod bay doors, KAL!
Whenever Im on the pad, launching that 30 meter rocket.
Oh my. Where did you get that amazing craft?

How about these?

Javascript is disabled. View full album
I told you this runway is too short.

Well, i've had some mild explosions from time to time. Nothing serious.

I may or may not of designed this craft with the sole intention of producing a really awesome explosion.

Attempting to land but misjudged the height of that ridge I'm about to slam into. Oh well might as well get a screenshot of the impending disaster...

But wait I didn't explode. I actually landed but ramped the ridge and shot off the other side. BTW did I mention I was out of fuel:

Actually manged to land again but not so fast...this did not end well. The ladder was not placed properly and the game glitched and ctd when I got out and tried to get back in. So all this never happened.

Some of those are hilarious

Here is one from earlier today

And this was another attempt to launch a problem craft

Having some "fun" with helicopters. this is a really old pic, but it always makes me laugh.

Oh my. Where did you get that amazing craft?

He made it himself.

Made like 6 variations of this thing and sent it everywhere, felt kinda good about it, then I noticed that I put the robotic core after the docking port and decoupler and effectively made my orbiter with refuel capabilities just an orbiter or space debris if I jettison the core. Looks like I will be sending several rescue missions and new scanning orbiters to some systems I expected to move this one around in.

It's difficult to see in this pic but trust me it's right there in between the docking port and probe core on the orbiter. Same thing for the lab below but at least I have more docking ports on it. Not that that makes Hadbald feel any better because it's the wrong size for him to dock.

Sucks hard.

Edited November 15, 2014 by Bigbootie
No, it did not end well.

http://imgur.com/gallery/naaUOlF/new

One of my more spectacular accidents

Im pretty sure those red tanks are supposed to be attached.....

I didn't manage to screenshot the splodie part that shortly followed this pic.

Decided to deorbit the Eve lander from its successful "get-to-orbit" test and land back at KSP. Came down on the wrong side of the mountains. (Actually most of the lander survived the 12 m/s landing on the 23 degree slope, but one of the mainsails blowed up real good.)

So I just noticed that it was the last engine in the asparagus (of a pair) that blowed up. So since this is Kerbin, not Eve (on Eve this would be doom), I am going to just deactivate the opposite mainsail, and try a reascent to orbit. (Yeehaw!)

Yah, nope. Missing mainsail left me too unbalanced.

Edited November 17, 2014 by James_Eh
Add results
they seem quite happy up there
Cockpits have monopropellant. This engine uses monopropellant. Therefore, I can actually probably get this into space without a single fuel tank. Or not.
Some great entries there.
Don't worry, they are wearing seat belts.

Nothing to see here, just a shuttle being normal.

(the wings collided with the launch pad 30km above KSC)
